title: Confused about JavaScript's 'reduce' method logic
content: Can someone explain how to properly set the initial value in the `reduce` method? I have an array of objects and I'm trying to sum a property, but I keep getting `[Object object]` as the result. What am I doing wrong?

title: Backend service successfully deployed on AWS Lambda! ðŸš€
content: Finally got my Node.js backend for my new project running on AWS Lambda with API Gateway. It was a steep learning curve but the performance and cost benefits are amazing. Serverless is the future!

comments.content: Congrats, Manas! That's a huge milestone.

title: What's the future of frontend frameworks? Svelte, Solid, or something new?
content: React, Vue, and Angular have been dominant for years. But with new compiler-based frameworks like Svelte and signal-based ones like Solid.js gaining traction, where do you see the frontend ecosystem heading in the next 3-5 years?

title: Best practices for REST API versioning?
content: My team is debating how to version our new API. URL-based (v1/users), header-based (Accept: application/vnd.company.v1+json), or query parameters? What are the pros and cons you've experienced with each approach?

title: Help with a complex MongoDB Aggregation Pipeline
content: I'm trying to perform a `$lookup` with a local and foreign field, then `$unwind` the result, but also keep documents that don't have a match. I think I need to use a combination of stages but I am getting lost. Any Mongo experts here?

title: Passed the Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) exam!
content: It was a tough, hands-on exam but I'm thrilled to announce I am now a Certified Kubernetes Administrator! A big thanks to this community for answering my questions along the way. #CKA #Kubernetes

title: CSS Flexbox vs Grid for a main page layout?
content: For a standard page layout with a header, footer, sidebar, and main content area, should I use CSS Grid for the overall structure and Flexbox for the components inside? Or can I just use Flexbox for everything? What are the modern conventions?

title: Are microservices always the answer? Let's talk about the monolith.
content: There's a lot of hype around microservices, but they introduce a lot of complexity (networking, discovery, distributed transactions). When is a well-structured monolith a better choice, especially for startups and small teams? Let's discuss the tradeoffs.

title: How to cache dependencies in a GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline?
content: My Node.js project's CI pipeline is slow because it runs `npm install` on every push. I know I can use `actions/cache` to speed this up, but I'm not sure how to configure the key and paths correctly for `node_modules`. Can anyone share a working example YAML?

codeSnippet.code:
- name: Cache node modules
  uses: actions/cache@v3
  with:
    path: ~/.npm
    key: ${{ runner.os }}-node-${{ hashFiles('**/package-lock.json') }}
    restore-keys: |
      ${{ runner.os }}-node-

title: My first PR to an open-source project was merged! ðŸŽ‰
content: I've been a long-time user of the `express` framework and today my first pull request to fix a small documentation typo was merged! It's a small step, but I'm proud to have contributed back to a project I use every day.
